details.description:
Jamie conducts qualitative and quantitative research to generate evidence on the economic, environmental and societal impact of open and shared data. He also supports the ODI’s UK and international policy work on transport and smart cities, coordinates ODI Showcase projects and liaises with ODI research fellows.

Jamie joined the ODI team in July 2014. He has since worked on research projects involving public, private and third sector organisations in the UK and abroad leading to the production of white papers, technical reports and case studies in a variety of sectors.

Jamie graduated with a BSc in Politics and International Relations from the University of Southampton, specialising in statistics and cooperative political theory.
